title: It could take 25 years for markets to recover if there is a recession – but here's why it doesn't matter
text:
An agreed Brexit deal might be cause for contentment in Westminster but for investors with money placed around the world, there remains a heavy stench of angst.

Why? Because of a wave of economic data that all points to a slowdown in growth. Fears remain heightened that another recession and downward trajectory for stock markets is on the horizon.

This comes at an interesting juncture for humanity. Today marks the 90th anniversary of the start of the The Great Depression. This was a meltdown of the financial system and a global economic slowdown and market crash so deep that it took the American market 25 years to reach its previous peak.
